Articles.Content:
Hey lads,

 

I am currently building a geostationary GPS system. Now i have placed four satalites in orbit. One w/o the sun, thus making is depending on the PB-nuk. Yet it is not delivering any power. I have set the activate function to a hotkey as it not apears when clicking it whit the right mouse button. beqause of this the  sat runs out of power :-(. Can i fix this or

Can I see a picture of your probe and or your mod list? Extraneous power users such as SAS, Ion Engines and antennae can drain power more rapidly than the RTG can generate. It's advisable to have more than 1 when using them.

A PB-nuk is always on but it generates only a tiny amount of power. Other parts (reaction wheels, probe core, lights, science, etc) might be drawing more power than the PB-nuk can generate. Try switching off things like lights and SAS, see if that helps.

18 hours ago, ZooNamedGames said:

Can I see a picture of your probe and or your mod list? Extraneous power users such as SAS, Ion Engines and antennae can drain power more rapidly than the RTG can generate. It's advisable to have more than 1 when using them.

How many rtg's are on the sat?
There are 4. Ill check em out

2 hours ago, chucknorris said:

There are 4. Ill check em out

The fastest way of finding out what changes have been made (if any) to the RTG is to open the ModuleManager.ConfigCache file in a text editor and look up the part. You will see the current state of the rtg part after all changed to it by any mods.
